comments.body: This throws right now if someone calls it without specifying a working directory.  If that's intended, we can change this to be an `@required` param, but I think this makes sense.
Is this because of an auto failure when no tests are run by the the underlying command? It seems weird that a generic 'runCommand' function knows anything about tests.

Yes. Currently a test run that runs no tests fails by default, and there's no way to know ahead of time (without trying to run them) that there are no tests to run.  I created an issue, but I don't know when/if they'll address it, so I added this here as a workaround. https://github.com/dart-lang/test/issues/1546
Got it. Perhaps put a link to this request here so we can remove if they fix the issue for us?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +202,206 @@  // https://github.com/dart-lang/test/issues/1546 is addressed. Remove the
  // workaround (parsing the test output) when/if that issue is fixed.
  final bool skipErrorExit = expectNoTests &&
      result != null &&
      result.flattenedStdout != null &&
